job.title: Up to $125,000/year | Advanced CNC Programmer | Competitive Salary!
job.description:
Please Note: We are willing to offer a relocation package for the right candidate! 


Position: Advanced CNC Programmer

Location: Mobile, AL

Pay: $80k to $125k/year

Experience:

  1. 5 to 7 years of advanced CNC programming and machinist experience. 
  2. Must have previous experience in a machine shop or shipyard with operating CNC machinery. 
  3. Proven experience programming multi-axis CNC machines and proficiency with CAM software (Mastercam strongly preferred).

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Manufacturing, Industrial, Mechatronics, or related Engineering field (or equivalent experience).

Type: Full-time; Direct Hire

Schedule: Monday – Friday, 7:30 AM to 4:00 PM


Clark Personnel is seeking an Advanced Programmer to join a growing and dynamic team!


Job Description:

  1. Program and operate multi-axis CNC machines (5-axis) for complex parts and tooling.
  2. Utilize CAM software, primarily Mastercam, to refine toolpaths and optimize machining efficiency.
  3. Translate blueprints, CAD files, or reverse-engineered parts into accurate CNC programs.
  4. Perform gear machining programming for spur, helical, worm, bevel, and spline gears.
  5. Apply solid understanding of tooling selection, toolpath management, feeds, and speeds.
  6. Reverse engineer parts from scans, prints, or samples into machine-ready code.
  7. Program and operate horizontal boring mills, CNC lathes, and milling machines.
  8. Troubleshoot and resolve CNC programming or setup issues.
  9. Ensure precision and accuracy in all machined components.
  10. Collaborate with the production team to meet quality and timeline goals.


Position Requirements:

  1. Multi-axis CAM programming (5-axis).
  2. Proficiency in Mastercam or equivalent CAM software.
  3. Gear machining programming expertise.
  4. CAD literacy and blueprint interpretation.
  5. Toolpath optimization and cutting tool selection.
  6. Knowledge of G-code and CNC setup/troubleshooting.
  7. Reverse engineering skills.
  8. Strong attention to detail.
  9. Problem-solving and adaptability.
  10. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  11. Strong organizational and time management skills.


Job Perks:

  1. 401 (k) 
  2. Health Benefits 


Clark Personnel is part of Array Corporation, the leading technology-enabled workforce solutions company whose mission is to fix how work is bought, sold and delivered to enable access to the American Dream.


We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

job.title: Up to $24/hour | Aluminum Fabrication Fitter | No Weekends!
job.description:
Position: Aluminum Fabrication Fitter

Location: Theodore, AL

Pay: $20 to $24/hour

Experience: Aluminum fabrication and fitting experience required, preferably in the marine or boat-building industry.

Education: High School Diploma.

Type: Full-time; Temp to Hire

Schedule: Monday – Thursday, 6:00 AM to 4:30 PM


Clark Personnel is seeking an Aluminum Fabrication Fitter to join a growing and dynamic team!


Job Description:

  1. Fabricate, fit, and assemble aluminum components based on blueprints and project specifications.
  2. Perform MIG and TIG aluminum welding with consistency and precision.
  3. Measure, cut, and shape aluminum materials using tools and fabrication equipment.
  4. Ensure proper alignment and secure fitting of all structural components.
  5. Inspect completed assemblies and materials for accuracy and adherence to standards.
  6. Perform structural repairs and modifications as required.
  7. Operate tools and machinery safely in accordance with safety protocols.
  8. Collaborate with designers and engineers to meet production goals.
  9. Follow marine and boat-building standards to maintain product quality.
  10. Maintain a clean, organized, and safe work environment at all times.


Position Requirements:

  1. Proficient in reading and interpreting blueprints and technical drawings.
  2. Strong MIG/TIG welding skills; pulse aluminum GMAW and/or GTAW preferred.
  3. Ability to pass certified welder tests per ABS and CWI standards.
  4. Skilled in precision measuring and cutting.
  5. Physically capable of lifting and handling heavy materials.
  6. Strong attention to detail and quality assurance.
  7. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  8. Safety-conscious and responsible.
  9. Reliable and committed to meeting project deadlines.


Job Perks: 

  1. Unlimited Career Growth Opportunities 
  2. Health Benefits after 30 days! 
  3. Weekly Paychecks! 
  4. Career coaching opportunities! 


Clark Personnel is part of Array Corporation, the leading technology-enabled workforce solutions company whose mission is to fix how work is bought, sold and delivered to enable access to the American Dream. 

 

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

job.title: $80k/year | Deputy Director of Nursing | Join Our Team!
job.description:
Position: Deputy Director of Nursing

Location: Mobile, AL

Pay: $80,000/year

Experience: Minimum of two (2) years of clinical nursing experience and at least one (1) year of supervisory or management experience.

Education: 

  1. Graduate of an accredited school of nursing leading to certification as a Registered Nurse.
  2. Current license to work in the State of Alabama. 

Type: Full-time; Contract  

Schedule: Monday - Friday, 8:00am to 5:00pm (Ability to work OT, evenings, holidays, and weekends as possible)

  

Clark Personnel is seeking a Deputy Director of Nursing to join a growing and dynamic team! The Deputy Director of Nursing is responsible for supporting and overseeing nursing operations across multiple clinical sites. This role assists with the planning, implementation, and evaluation of nursing care in accordance with organizational policies, standards, and regulatory requirements.


Essential Functions

  1. Continuously evaluates nursing operations and provides reports and recommendations for improvement to the Director of Nursing.
  2. Join facilitates departmental meetings as needed, including preparing agendas, maintaining minutes, and tracking delegated tasks.
  3. Participate in the development, implementation, and evaluation of departmental goals and objectives.
  4. Support community outreach, health education programs, and related activities as assigned.
  5. Plan, assign, and direct the work of nursing staff.
  6. Addresses staff concerns and resolves workplace issues.
  7. Perform patient triage for walk-in patients and phone inquiries, prioritizing care based on urgency.
  8. Respond to medical emergencies and provide patient education as appropriate.
  9. Maintain exam rooms, supplies, equipment, and medication inventories.
  10. Performs additional duties as assigned by nursing leadership.


Position Requirements: 

  1. CPR certification.
  2. Rotates between clinical units or locations as needed.
  3. Demonstrated clinical competence and leadership skills.
  4. Strong communication, organizational, and problem-solving abilities.
  5. Ability to delegate duties effectively and manage multiple priorities.

 

Clark Personnel is part of Array Corporation, the leading technology-enabled workforce solutions company whose mission is to fix how work is bought, sold and delivered to enable access to the American Dream. 

 

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

job.title: $15/hour | Field Maintenance Tech | Temporary Assignment
job.description:
Position: Field Maintenance Tech

Location: Daphne, AL

Pay: $15/hour

Experience: Experience in landscaping, groundskeeping, or related fields preferred

Type: Full-time; Temporary (4 to 12 weeks)

Schedule: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday, 6:00 AM to 3:30 PM

 

Clark Personnel is seeking a Field Maintenance Tech to join a growing and dynamic team!

  2. Operate and maintain basic landscaping equipment and tools
  3. Assist with the construction, repair, and maintenance of parks and recreation facilities
  4. Ensure public areas remain clean, safe, and presentable

job.title: $22/hour | Manufacturing Operator | Weekly Pay!
job.description:
Position: Manufacturing Operator

Location: Calvert, AL

Pay: $22/hour

Experience:

  1. Proven experience operating an overhead crane and forklift is required.
  2. Previous experience in manufacturing, mill operations, or heavy industry strongly preferred.

Education: High School Diploma or GED is required.

Type: Full-time; Contract

Schedule: 12-hour rotating swing shifts (2-3-2), 7:00am to 7:00pm or 6:00am to 6:00pm

 

Clark Personnel is seeking a Manufacturing Operator to join a growing and dynamic team! 

 

Job Description:

  1. Operate overhead cranes and forklifts safely and efficiently.
  2. Perform production tasks in a manufacturing, mill, or heavy industrial setting.
  3. Follow detailed, step-by-step procedures and document the completion of critical processes.
  4. Comply with all safety regulations, guidelines, and operational standards.
  5. Maintain awareness of equipment condition and report issues as needed.


Position Requirements

  1. Ability to follow strict procedures and accurately document work.
  2. Basic understanding of mechanical machinery and operating principles preferred.
  3. Basic computer skills, including data entry and email communication.
  4. Mechanical aptitude, including comfort using tools to perform simple repairs.
  5. Strong attention to detail, reliability, and safety awareness.

job.title: $35/hour | Large CNC Machine Operator | Mobile, AL
job.description:
Position: Large CNC Machine Operator  

Location: Mobile, AL

Pay: $35/hour

Experience: 3–5 years of experience operating Horizontal Boring Mills (manual and/or CNC). 

Type: Full-time; Contract  

Schedule: Monday - Friday, 7:30am to 4:00pm 

  

Clark Personnel is seeking a Large CNC Machine Operator to join a growing and dynamic team!   

  

Job Description:  

  1. Set up and operate large CNC Horizontal Boring Mills and Vertical Turning Lathes.
  2. Interpret blueprints, engineering drawings, and GD&T specifications to ensure precise machining.
  3. Write, edit, and troubleshoot CNC programs using G-code and Fanuc controls.
  4. Perform tooling setup, offsets, and adjustments to maintain optimal part quality.
  5. Utilize precision measuring tools (micrometers, calipers, bore gauges, etc.) for inspection and verification.
  6. Safely move and position heavy parts using overhead cranes and other lifting equipment.
  7. Conduct routine maintenance and ensure machines are running efficiently.
  8. Identify and resolve machining issues to minimize downtime and improve quality.
  9. Collaborate with team members to meet production goals while maintaining a clean and safe workspace.

 

Position Requirements: 

  1. Experience with setting up and operating large CNC Horizontal Boring Mills.
  2. Vertical Turning Lathe experience.
  3. Understanding of blueprint interpretation, GD&T, and CNC programming (G-code, Fanuc, etc.).
  4. Strong problem-solving, safety awareness, and the ability to manage heavy parts—often using cranes.
  5. Capability to thrive in a high-volume, industrial environment—both independently and collaboratively.   

 

Clark Personnel is part of Array Corporation, the leading technology-enabled workforce solutions company whose mission is to fix how work is bought, sold and delivered to enable access to the American Dream. 

 

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

job.title: $23/hour | Paralegal | Grow Your Career!
job.description:
Position: Paralegal

Location: Daphne, AL

Pay: $23/hour

Experience: 2 years of experience in Alabama and Florida law; litigation, insurance, wrongful death, and construction/condo law is strongly preferred.

Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Paralegal Studies or Bachelor’s Degree in Legal Studies.

Type: Full-time; Contract

Schedule: Monday – Friday, 8:00am to 5:00pm


Clark Personnel is seeking a Paralegal to join a growing and dynamic boutique civil law firm composed of five attorneys. The firm specializes in condominium, HOA, and construction law. The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of experience with Alabama and Florida law. If you’re looking to expand your knowledge and grow your legal career, we encourage you to apply!


Job Description:

  1. Support attorneys in litigation, insurance, wrongful death, and construction/condo law cases.
  2. Draft, organize, and prepare legal documents and case files.
  3. Conduct legal research related to Alabama and Florida law.
  4. Manage case deadlines, filings, and correspondence.
  5. Assist with trial preparation and discovery tasks.
  6. Maintain organized and accurate case documentation.
  7. Communicate professionally with clients, attorneys, and external parties.


Position Requirements:

  1. Ability to learn quickly and adapt to changing attorney demands.
  2. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
  3. Ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality.
  4. Reliable attendance and professionalism.
  5. Ability to manage shifting priorities in a fast-paced legal environment.


Job Perks:

  1. Health Insurance
  2. Dental Insurance
  3. Vision Insurance
  4. Life A&D Insurance


Clark Personnel is part of Array Corporation, the leading technology-enabled workforce solutions company whose mission is to fix how work is bought, sold and delivered to enable access to the American Dream.


We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

job.title: $25/hour | Production Planner | Calvert, AL
job.description:
Position: Production Planner  

Location: Calvert, AL

Pay: $25/hour

Experience: 4-5 years of experience in operations, industrial manufacturing, supply chain, lumber, paper, pulp, or steel work.

Type: Full-time; Contract  

Schedule: Monday - Friday, 6:00am to 2:30pm (Ability to work OT as needed)

  

Clark Personnel is seeking a Production Planner to join a growing and dynamic team!   

  

Job Description: 

  1. Assist with planning and scheduling production and maintenance activities.
  2. Track production metrics, maintenance records, and operational data.
  3. Prepare reports, spreadsheets, and documentation using Microsoft Word and Excel.
  4. Analyze numerical data to support planning decisions and operational efficiency.
  5. Coordinate with production, maintenance, and operations teams to ensure timelines are met.
  6. Maintain accurate records and update schedules as needed.
  7. Identify discrepancies or issues and communicate them.


Position Requirements: 

  1. Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.
  2. Strong numerical and analytical skills.
  3. High attention to detail and accuracy.
  4. Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  5. Strong organizational and communication skills.

job.title: $27/hour | Experienced Industrial Pump Mechanic | Competitive Pay!
job.description:
Position: Industrial Pump Mechanic

Location: Mobile, AL

Pay: $27/hour

Experience: At least 5 years of experience inspecting, diagnosing, and repairing industrial pumps.

Education: High school diploma or equivalent; technical certifications preferred.

Type: Full-time; Temp to Perm

Schedule: Monday – Friday, 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM


Clark Personnel is seeking an Experienced Industrial Pump Mechanic to join a growing and dynamic team!


Job Description:

  1. Inspect, diagnose, and repair a variety of pumps, including centrifugal, gear, and diaphragm models.
  2. Perform routine preventive maintenance and alignment to ensure safe and efficient operation.
  3. Replace worn or damaged components such as seals, bearings, and impellers.
  4. Read and interpret technical drawings, schematics, and maintenance manuals to troubleshoot issues.
  5. Conduct vibration analysis and pump alignment for high-demand industrial systems.
  6. Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities and report issues to management.
  7. Collaborate with team members to ensure timely completion of repairs and preventive maintenance tasks.
  8. Follow all safety procedures and maintain compliance with company and industry standards.


Position Requirements:

  1. Strong mechanical troubleshooting and diagnostic skills for industrial pump systems.
  2. Knowledge of centrifugal, gear, diaphragm, and specialty pumps used in steel and paper mill operations.
  3. Proficiency in reading and interpreting schematics, blueprints, and technical manuals.
  4. Preventive maintenance and repair of pumps, valves, and rotating equipment.
  5. Precision measuring skills using micrometers, calipers, and dial indicators.
  6. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
  7. Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality and safety standards.


Job Perks: 

  1. Unlimited Career Growth Opportunities 
  2. Health Benefits after 30 days! 
  3. Weekly Paychecks! 
  4. Career coaching opportunities! 

 

Clark Personnel is part of Array Corporation, the leading technology-enabled workforce solutions company whose mission is to fix how work is bought, sold and delivered to enable access to the American Dream.


We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

job.title: $28.32/hour | Experienced Shipfitter | Weekly Paychecks!
job.description:
Position: Shipfitter

Location: Theodore, AL

Pay: $28.32/hour

Experience: 3 years of experience as a shipfitter (or in a related marine/manufacturing/fabrication environment).

Type: Full-time; Contract  

Schedule: Day Shift or Night Shift


Clark Personnel is hiring experienced Shipfitters to support shipbuilding and fabrication work on steel and aluminum vessels. This role is hands-on and requires strong layout, cutting, and blueprint-reading skills.

  

Job Description:  

  1. Read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and specifications.
  2. Perform layout, cutting, and fitting of steel and aluminum using appropriate tools and equipment.
  3. Execute basic welding tasks, including tack welding, to support proper fit-up and alignment.
  4. Measure and verify dimensions using tape measures and other measuring devices to maintain accuracy and material “fairness.”
  5. Identify fit-up or alignment issues and promptly notify supervisors to prevent rework or safety concerns.
  6. Operate tools and equipment safely while following all safety policies and procedures.
  7. Communicate effectively with supervisors and team members to support project timelines and quality standards.
  8. Maintain tools and work areas in a safe, organized condition.


Position Requirements:    

  1. Ability to read and understand blueprints and technical drawings.
  2. Proficiency in layout and cutting of steel and aluminum.
  3. Basic welding experience, including the ability to tack weld.
  4. Ownership of basic tools required to perform shipfitter duties.
  5. Strong math skills with the ability to read measuring devices and maintain dimensional accuracy.
  6. Proven problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  7. Good verbal communication skills.
  8. Strong work ethic, reliability, and ability to work well in a team environment.
  9. Commitment to safe work practices and compliance with safety standards.

 

Clark Personnel is part of Array Corporation, the leading technology-enabled workforce solutions company whose mission is to fix how work is bought, sold and delivered to enable access to the American Dream. 

 

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

job.title: $22/hour | Support Manager | Hiring ASAP!
job.description:
Position: Support Manager

Location: Daphne, AL

Pay: $22/hour + leasing bonuses

Experience: At least 3 years of conventional apartment leasing experience required; Assistant Property Manager experience preferred.

Type: Full-time; Contract

Schedule: Monday–Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM


Clark Personnel is seeking a Support Manager to join a growing and dynamic team!


Job Description:

  1. Manage and support leasing activities for a conventional apartment community.
  2. Assist the Property Manager with lease renewals and resident retention.
  3. Oversee maintenance work orders and resident satisfaction follow-up.
  4. Show apartments and support make-ready and presentation standards.
  5. Plan and execute monthly resident events.
  6. Track leasing activity and support bonus-driven performance goals.


Position Requirements:

  1. Proven conventional property leasing experience.
  2. Strong customer service and resident relations skills.
  3. Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  4. Familiarity with property management software; OneSite experience preferred.
  5. Professional communication and organizational skills.

job.title: $23.50/hour | Welder | Hiring ASAP!
job.description:
Position: Welder

Location: Theodore, AL

Pay: $23.50/hour

Experience: At least 3 years as a First-Class Flux Core Welder.

Education: High School Diploma.

Type: Full-time; Contract

Schedule: Morning shift, Monday–Friday, 8 hours per shift (shift times may fluctuate)


Clark Personnel is seeking a Welder to join a growing and dynamic team!


Job Description:

  1. Perform flux core welding (FCAW) on carbon steel, stainless steel, and/or aluminum.
  2. Execute multi-pass welds in all positions (flat, horizontal, vertical, overhead).
  3. Read and interpret blueprints, welding symbols, and technical drawings.
  4. Cut, fit, and assemble structural components for shipyard fabrication.
  5. Prepare metal surfaces by grinding, cleaning, and beveling.
  6. Conduct visual weld inspections and support basic NDT practices.
  7. Operate and maintain welding equipment, grinders, torches, and measuring tools.


Position Requirements:

  1. Strong FCAW proficiency.
  2. Ability to interpret shipyard blueprints and welding schematics.
  3. Skilled in structural fitting and metal preparation.
  4. Knowledge of weld quality standards and defect correction.
  5. Ability to follow shipyard safety protocols, PPE rules, and hot-work procedures.


Clark Personnel is part of Array Corporation, the leading technology-enabled workforce solutions company whose mission is to fix how work is bought, sold and delivered to enable access to the American Dream.


We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.
